div.p: The Widget is built with widget factory and can be extended. When extending widgets, you have the ability to override or add to the behavior of existing methods.

All of jQuery UI's widgets expose two types of methods - both of which are available for extension. The first type are methods that can be invoked using the widget's plugin (e.g. $( ".selector" ).( "widget" )); these are documented here. The second type cannot be invoked using the plugin, but are still considered public API methods that are safe to override. These methods are listed below.
For more information on widget extension, see Extending Widgets with the Widget Factory.
